bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
With build python-behave-1.2.5-13.fc24 there's no longer python-behave and python3-behave packages. Instead there are python2-behave and python3-behave.
The '/usr/bin/behave' executable is now tied to the python3 package and the python3 package only. With python3 being the default python for fedora now I get that when both are installed. However, if only python2-behave is installed, the "behave" executable should link to the "behave-2".
Basically this was already case of bz 1319632 for the previous "python-behave" package and 1.2.5-13 broke that. For us, this is a compat issue, but should this go against policies, we can workaround this.
This might also be a mid-release change that could be unacceptable for F23 (although the build has failed there).
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): python-behave-1.2.5-13.fc24

So, this is actually a bug. Per https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:Python#Naming:
# If executables are to be shipped for both python 2 and python 3 ... The unversioned executable must be the python2 version.
